intro: Synaedrys woodii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming a rosette structure with compact foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are pollinated by insects. Synaedrys woodii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
